oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Roy Acuff with Mayor Briley, between 1963 and 1975
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Country music singer Roy Acuff, pictured with Mayor Beverly Briley. Roy Claxton Acuff was born in Maynardville, Tennessee in 1903. He was an American country music singer, fiddler, and promoter. He joined the Grand Ole Opry in 1938 and was a leading figure for nearly four decades. Acuff co-founded the first major Nashville-based country music publishing company: Acuff-Rose Music, which signed acts such as Hank Williams, Roy Orbison, and The Everly Brothers. In 1962, Acuff became the first living inductee into the Country Music Hall of Fame. Clifton Beverly Briley, a native of Nashville, was the first mayor of the newly consolidated metropolitan government of Nashville and Davidson County. He served from 1963 to 1975. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 film strip negative : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Briley, Beverly, 1914-1980; Acuff, Roy
